snippet: The Warriors are in some trouble against Damian Lillard and the Portland Trail Blazers in the Western Conference semifinals. Curry may be ready, but comes with risks.
abstract: Scott Cacciola On Pro Basketball column contends that Golden State Warriors will have hard time defeating Portland Trail Blazers in playoffs without their star point guard Stephen Curry, who has been sidelined with knee injury; notes that Trail Blazers are being led by one of league’s most dynamic guards--Damian Lillard--who became first player in NBA history to have at least 40 points, 10 assists, 5 rebounds and 5 3-pointers in single playoff game.
lead_paragraph: The Warriors are in some trouble against Damian Lillard and the Portland Trail Blazers in the Western Conference semifinals. Curry may be ready, but comes with risks.

headline.print_headline: Lillard’s 40 Points Complicate the Math on Curry
headline.main: Damian Lillard’s 40 Points Complicates the Math on Stephen Curry
